poem:
Morning Disruptions

The clock ticks past midnight,  
a symphony of alarms ignored.  
Skin to skin, even miles apart,  
they blur time's line—  
love's ceaseless undertow.  
Meetings dissolve like sugar;  
intimacy telegraphs  
across continents,  
their whispers erasing borders.  
She wonders: Are we unmoored?  
Yet in this ecstatic drift,  
they find their shared compass.
